result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING DECEMBER 4, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 40.

miscConds.notes: Set at $2,033.87 payable to Chelsea S.  To be paid first and foremost.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with victim unless the victim request contact and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Successfully complete any other counselig and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supevision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found domestic abuse surcharge is applicable, but waived.  
Defendant to pay DNA surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil jdugment and/or tax intercept or other means.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-04-15 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time in the HOC

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Chelsea S.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 66 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-AS TO COUNT 1:  As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  No good time.
-AS TO COUNT 2:  Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable, but is waived.  Defendant to pay DNA surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Restitution is set at $2033.87; payable to Chelsea S.. to be paid first and foremost.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial hearing.  Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Parties informed the Court this matter may resolve and they would like another final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No contact with the victim.  No firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Argument heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail set at $500.00.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1,500.00 signature bond) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  (Discharge Summary)  rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  rmm
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed.   rmm
Defendant most participate with treatment at Genisis.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter here on defendant's positive drug tests.  Court admonished defendant and advised him he must participate in Genisis  treatment program.  Case remains set for final pretrial on 2/06/15.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Shannon Fettig.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: CHELSEA S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jacob Douglas Eastman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 2 ( Misdemeanor). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
